document.docAuthor: Qiao, Gexia, Jiang, Liyun & Martin, Jon H.
document.masterDocTitle: Aulacophoroides (Sternorrhyncha: Aphididae), a generic account, description of a new species from Hong Kong (China) and a key to species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Aulacophoroides (Sternorrhyncha: Aphididae), a generic account, description of a new species from Hong Kong (China) and a key to species

Aulacophoroides hoffmanni (Takahashi)

Eastop and Hille Ris Lambers, 1976

.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. 56 apterous viviparous females and 21 nymphs,
1985 ­V­ 21
, CHINA (Zhejiang, Hangzhou City, Botanic Garden), on
Wisteria sinensis (V. F. Eastop)
( BMNH ).

tr.th: Part (for abbreviations see Materials and Methods, p. 2) URS (accessory)

subSubSection.paragraph: Setae on Tergum I / Ant. IIIWD 1.41 1.20–1.67 0.25
Setae on Tergum VIII / Ant. IIIWD 1.57 1.40–1.78 0.22
Setae on hind tibia / MW of hind tibia 1.20 1.10–1.38 0.20

Distribution. China (Zhejiang, Hangzhou; Shandong). Host plant.
Wisteria sinensis
.
Biology. A field note (Victor Eastop) states that the body colour was a rich chestnut brown in life.
